Title: Compliance Analyst
Description: * *  *   This position can be remote, hybrid or in-office!*    GET TO KNOW US Gurstel Law Firm, P.C. (hereinafter “Gurstel” or “Firm”) is a multi-state litigation law firm representing creditors in all aspects of the legal collection process. The Firm is headquartered in Golden Valley, Minnesota with offices in Arizona, California, Iowa, Nebraska, Nevada, Utah, Wisconsin, and Wyoming.*    CULTURE At Gurstel, we operate on our Core Values of Doing Right, Achieving Results, and Maintaining our Integrity. We champion diversity and are a very fast-paced, enthusiastic group of people! Success is celebrated and we are looking for people who share those same values with the drive to exceed expectations and think outside the box! Our culture is what makes our Firm a fun and rewarding place to work.*    JOB SUMMARY*    The Compliance Managing Attorney oversees the Firm’s Consumer Compliance Management System (CCMS). The CCMS is how the Firm establishes and manages its compliance responsibilities, including creating internal processes and procedures (P&P) addressing compliance requirements; communicating about compliance responsibilities to employees: working with the Firm’s Executive Leadership and management to ensure that legal requirements are met; and incorporating internal P&Ps into the Firm’s processes.*    The Compliance program is an independent and objective authority that reviews, promotes, and evaluates regulatory and operational compliance matters within the Firm. The Compliance Managing Attorney works with the CCO and other Firm leaders to ensure the Firm and its operations are in compliance with consumer financial protection state and federal law, and that risk is managed well throughout the Firm.*    The Compliance Analyst supports all aspects of the Firm’s CCMS by performing a variety of duties in the Compliance Department under the direction of the Compliance Managing Attorney and CCO.*    DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*    As a Compliance Analyst at the Firm, you will be responsible for implementing many aspects of the CCMS, including the internal compliance audit program, the consumer complaint management program, the letter control management program, and the vendor management program. You are a highly skilled, passionate, and self-motivated compliance professional with previous compliance experience, preferably in debt collection or financial services. You will collaborate and partner with managers throughout the Firm to develop and maintain key elements of the Firm’s compliance program, including compliance risk assessments, establishment and implementation of P&Ps, and delivery of compliance training and awareness.*    The major areas of responsibility for this position:*    Maintain up-to-date knowledge of both federal and applicable state consumer protection rules and regulations. Assist Compliance Attorneys to analyze and formulate a plan for implementing new or revised regulations. Determine applicability of new/revised regulations to various Departments.*     Conduct internal compliance audits of functions throughout the Firm that have been identified as presenting risk to the Firm.*     Assist with conducting regulatory and compliance remote and onsite audits of Firm vendors.*     Assist with the Compliance Department’s response to client audits and other similar audits/inquiries by third parties, by gathering and reviewing all Department records responsive to the audit/inquiry and ensuring they are accurate and responsive.*     Assist with the Compliance Department’s implementation of new client directives.*     Draft P&Ps prepare communication materials and trainings about P&Ps and deliver communications and trainings to Firm employees.*     Manage specific assigned projects in support of the compliance program, related to consumer complaint management, letter control management, and other compliance functions and programs.*     Analyze data related to Compliance Department functions and propose solutions to solve problems identified and improvements to internal controls.*     Maintain awareness of the Firm’s P&Ps and its IT systems, including the Firm’s debt collection litigation system of record.*     Serve as a resource person to answer questions from employees throughout the Firm, and train new Compliance Department team members on the Department’s functions and the Firm’s compliance requirements.*     For audit activities:*      Conduct risk assessments and identify controls in place to mitigate identified risks.*       Perform audit procedures to verify that controls are operating, through testing and interviewing techniques.*       Analyze and determines if effective and efficient controls exist and identify control gaps and opportunities for improvement.*       Review, investigate and evaluate systems and files for regulatory compliance and compliance with Firm requirements.*       Document results in formal audit reports for timely submission to a compliance attorney.*       Identify noncompliant trends and remediations needed.*       Develop and issue remediation plans and monitor to confirm that remediation plans are timely implemented.*       Continually assess audit processes to look for ways to enhance the Firm’s audits and reviews.*     *    QUALIFICATIONS:*    In-depth understanding of state and federal consumer protection laws, and compliance operations and best practices. Understanding of creditors’ rights industry and trends.*     Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills, including training skills, demonstrating ability to collaborate and successfully interact with all levels of employees and leaders in the Firm.*     Strong skills in relationship building, independent judgment, and problem solving.*     Results and detail oriented, producing thorough analyses.*     Exceptional time management skills to meet strict assignment deadlines.*     Able to provide objective and fair assessments.*     Able to multi-task.*     Self-motivated.*     Bachelor’s degree OR equivalent experience handling complaints in the debt collection industry.*     Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook.*     Data analytics skills a plus.*     Bi-lingual in Spanish (read, write and speak) is a plus!*    COMPENSENSATION/BENEFITS:*    Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays*     Medical, Dental, Vision*     401k and profit sharing*     Competitive wages*    We are looking for individuals who share our Core Values: Do Right, Achieve Results, and Maintain Integrity.*    Please submit Resume and Salary Requirements for consideration.*    EOE*  * *

Virta is changing this by helping people reverse type 2 diabetes through innovations in technology, personalized nutrition, and virtual care delivery reinvented from the ground up. Join us on our mission to reverse diabetes in 100M people by 2025. *  As a full stack health care company of physicians, engineers, marketers and more under one roof, Virta collects comprehensive data on our patients’ experience. The Applied AI team leverages this data to build the next generation of health care for chronic diseases. As a member of this team, you will build and interpret intelligent systems that power our product in order to scale the treatment, drive patient acquisition, and improve patient outcomes. *  Check out our technical blog to find out how Virta is developing the next generation of healthcare technology: https://www.virtahealth.com/health-tech *  Responsibilities * Applied AI Products: Research, develop, deploy, and monitor intelligent systems to improve patient acquisition and outcomes at scale *   Reframe vague but mission-critical business objectives into empirical problems that can be addressed with machine learning, optimization routines, and statistical modeling *    Conduct exploratory analyses of users and business processes to understand your datasets and make excellent modeling choices downstream *    Leverage our platform/tooling to develop and deploy models in our production environment *    Understand the impact of your models on user and business level KPIs; leverage this understanding to guide subsequent efforts *   *  Applied AI Platform: Collaborate with other machine learning engineers in designing extensible software and infrastructure to accelerate model training, serving, and operations *  Product Leadership: Participate in setting the direction of highly cross functional teams (incl.
